thread.title: Some fans loved Sutton United keeper Wayne Shaw eating a pie against Arsenal - and some fans HATED it
thread.title_full: Some fans loved Sutton United keeper Wayne Shaw eating a pie against Arsenal - and some fans HATED it

author: Richard Innes
title: Some fans loved Sutton United keeper Wayne Shaw eating a pie against Arsenal - and some fans HATED it
text:
YUM YUM YUM (Photo: BBC) Share Get Arsenal FC     
The FA Cup tie against Arsenal was Sutton United's 15 minutes of fame. 
For Sutton players like Roarie Deacon and Jamie Collins, the match was the perfect shop window; a chance to show clubs at a higher level that they can play a bit. 
For reserve goalkeeper Wayne Shaw - who was always unlikely to get on the pitch - the Fifth Round match presented the opportunity to make himself famous… for being 'big'. 
The 45 year-old, 23-stone 'roly poly keeper' was the subject of plenty of pre-match attention, becoming something of a comedy cult hero in the build-up to the game. However, Shaw also managed to grab the limelight DURING the match too… by eating a pie on camera. Sutton United's Wayne Shaw with his own form of those energy gels (Photo: REUTERS) 
The sight of the reserve keeper wolfing down a pie while the game was still in progress - albeit after Sutton had used their third and final substitute - has caused quite a stir. Read More Sutton United manager slams 'roly poly' goalkeeper over pie-eating 'stunt' 
Many supporters loved it. However, his own manager, Paul Dowsett, was less than impressed, saying, "I don't think it shows us in the best light.” More significantly for some fans, amid claims the whole pie-scoffing business was a PR stunt for an online bookmaker, there are suggestions Shaw (who has made clear none of the Sutton players placed any bets on it) might face an FA probe. Wayne Shaw enjoying the limelight on Good Morning Britain (Photo: Rex Features) In short, Shaw has divided the internet. On the one hand, lots of fans were quick to declare Shaw a legend and a hero: However, there were plenty of other (largely sarcastic) fans who thought Shaw had basically ruined the FA Cup So, where do you stand? Is Shaw a hero or a disgrace? Vote now! poll loading What did you make of Wayne Shaw's pie-eating antics during Sutton v Arsenal? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
